newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RBNZ to buy back July 1997 bonds.
newsitem.headline: RBNZ to buy back July 1997 bonds.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand said on Friday it was offering to repurchase government bonds maturing July 15, 1997 as part of its liquidity management operations.
The offer takes effect from 1 p.m. (0000 GMT) on Friday and will remain open until further notice.
As at December 31, 1996, the net total of 7/97 bonds in the market was NZ$1.96 billion.
Dealers said it was fairly routine for the Reserve Bank to offer to repurchase short-dated bonds as soon as they came under six months to maturity.
However, the bank had not traditionally been an aggressive buyer, and its lack of competitiveness could explain the lack of a substantial rally in the 7/97s after the announcement.
The bond yield, currently nine basis points lower at 7.28 percent on the back of a strong money market, did not change at all on the back of the announcement.

"It's been interesting today that the yield on them hasn't really rallied since the Reserve Bank came out and announced it. In the past the market rallied, but I think they've now realised that the Reserve Bank is never that close to the market. It tends to be always be wanting a bargain," one dealer said.
"In the past the buy-back operations have not been all that successful." -- Wellington Newsroom (64 4) 4734746
